revised_title: Reinvestigation of Energetics and Decay of Muscular Contraction
tldr: The author investigates the energetics of muscular contraction and relaxation, discovering that heat production and work continue during the early stages of relaxation. They argue that the active state set up by a stimulus remains at its maximum for a while before gradually decaying, making it difficult to divide the process into two separate processes of contraction and relaxation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
